org.point85.uom

Class Conversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.point85.uom.Conversion

  • public class Conversion
extends java.lang.Object
    A Conversion linearly relates an ordinate unit (y) to an abscissa unit (x) by the equation y = ax + b. Here 'a' is the slope or scaling factor (a.k.a. constant of proportionality) and 'b' is the y-intercept (offset). For example, 1 km = 1000m, factor (a) = 1000 and offset (b) = 0; 1 C = 1K - 273.15, 'a' = 1 and offset (b) = -273.15.
